Bachelor & Georgiy Kain

1.Georgiy Kain: Yes, what is it?

1.Georgiy Kain: Yes, what is it?

2.Bachelor: I wanted to ask you about Rubin. What do you intend to do with him?

2.Bachelor: I wanted to ask you about Rubin. What do you intend to do with him?

3.Georgiy Kain: Say what you will, doctor, but I'll adress the matter as I see fit. Rubin is going to give himself up to me of his own free will. Say your farewells. From now on you are the only one able to save us.

3.Georgiy Kain: Say what you will, doctor, but I'll adress the matter as I see fit. Rubin is going to give himself up to me of his own free will. Say your farewells. From now on you are the only one able to save us.

4.Bachelor: Have mercy for him.

4.Bachelor: Have mercy for him.

2.Bachelor: I'm looking for the carrier, Judge. The one who most likely was, after all, Simon's murderer.

2.Bachelor: I'm looking for the carrier, Judge. The one who most likely was, after all, Simon's murderer.

3.Georgiy Kain: Cruel irony! Why on the exact day I found out that my brother wasn't murdered and my awful suspicion is proven true-you acknowledge the existence of a killer! No, doctor. I thank you, but... I have no more desire to hunt murderers.

3.Georgiy Kain: Cruel irony! Why on the exact day I found out that my brother wasn't murdered and my awful suspicion is proven true-you acknowledge the existence of a killer! No, doctor. I thank you, but... I have no more desire to hunt murderers.

4.Bachelor: But I do! If we give over the murderous carrier to the Inquisitor, he will be appeased. This will grant us respite from further oppression.

4.Bachelor: But I do! If we give over the murderous carrier to the Inquisitor, he will be appeased. This will grant us respite from further oppression.

5.Georgiy Kain: I doubt that. You don't seem to understand the nature of the inquisitors too well, my dear doctor Dankovsky. Trust me, they will send Karminsky or Orff here, and both are well known for their remarkable ruthlessness. They will happily exterminate the carrier... but one execution won't suffice to appease them.

5.Georgiy Kain: I doubt that. You don't seem to understand the nature of the inquisitors too well, my dear doctor Dankovsky. Trust me, they will send Karminsky or Orff here, and both are well known for their remarkable ruthlessness. They will happily exterminate the carrier... but one execution won't suffice to appease them.

6.Bachelor: You are mistaken. I know inquisitors well enough.

6.Bachelor: You are mistaken. I know inquisitors well enough.

6.Bachelor: ...At least I will fulfill my obligation to the Powers That Be and save my Thanatica.

6.Bachelor: ...At least I will fulfill my obligation to the Powers That Be and save my Thanatica.

2.Bachelor: What happens now?

2.Bachelor: What happens now?

3.Georgiy Kain: Olgimsky will try his best to burn the girl at the stake. Talk to her-you're the least likely to fall under her spell. Perhaps she'll you tell something of interest...

4.Bachelor: Where can I find her?

4.Bachelor: Where can I find her?

5.Georgiy Kain: She was staying with the Saburov family first, but then they presented her with her own house. She is too afraid to stay there alone, though. Instead, the girl keeps hiding in the foulest slums this town has to offer. Apparently, the disease does nothing to her.

6.Bachelor: Those are sinister signs. And do you not want to catch her?

1.Georgiy Kain: Most venerable doctor! It is with great impatience that we have been expecting you. You need not delve into the minutiae of your business with us since our family is well acquainted with your scholarly work. We are also quite aware of the difficulties you were experiencing and well-prepared to do our utmost to support you. It hurts me all the more to be the one to inform you that Simon, my consanguineous brother, the creator, keeper and embodiment of all that surrounds us, has been murdered.

1.Georgiy Kain: Most venerable doctor! It is with great impatience that we have been expecting you. You need not delve into the minutiae of your business with us since our family is well acquainted with your scholarly work. We are also quite aware of the difficulties you were experiencing and well-prepared to do our utmost to support you. It hurts me all the more to be the one to inform you that Simon, my consanguineous brother, the creator, keeper and embodiment of all that surrounds us, has been murdered.

2.Bachelor: I can't believe it.....It cannot be!

2.Bachelor: I can't believe it.....It cannot be!

3.Georgiy Kain: My brother was murdered last night, under the strangest of circumstances. But, for all the mystery surrounding his death, I'd rather eschew the notion that his... departure was connected with whoever had visited Simon that evening. The visitor is a man of laudable rectitude and an old friend of our family. There are witnesses to testify that he and Simon did nothing but converse.

3.Georgiy Kain: My brother was murdered last night, under the strangest of circumstances. But, for all the mystery surrounding his death, I'd rather eschew the notion that his... departure was connected with whoever had visited Simon that evening. The visitor is a man of laudable rectitude and an old friend of our family. There are witnesses to testify that he and Simon did nothing but converse.

4.Bachelor: Who was the visitor?

4.Bachelor: Who was the visitor?

5.Georgiy Kain: Someone you know quite well. The man whom my brother saw last night was your colleague, Isidor Burakh. Was he not the the very person to advise you come here as well?

5.Georgiy Kain: Someone you know quite well. The man whom my brother saw last night was your colleague, Isidor Burakh. Was he not the the very person to advise you come here as well?

6.Bachelor: Yes.

6.Bachelor: Yes.

7.Georgiy Kain: Hmm... Isidor has done more than he thinks... I have a lingering feeling that time itself is using uncontestable powers to further its own intentions. What do you think?

7.Georgiy Kain: Hmm... Isidor has done more than he thinks... I have a lingering feeling that time itself is using uncontestable powers to further its own intentions. What do you think?

8.Bachelor: I'm no fatalist.

8.Bachelor: I'm no fatalist.

9.Georgiy Kain: It could be that my mind is clouded by sorrow, but I cannot escape the feeling that your arrival was no coincidence. Your choice was made for you, my dear doctor! Let us not blame... fate for it. Isidor wrote to you without making us aware. He took a risk that could have displeased our family.

9.Georgiy Kain: It could be that my mind is clouded by sorrow, but I cannot escape the feeling that your arrival was no coincidence. Your choice was made for you, my dear doctor! Let us not blame... fate for it. Isidor wrote to you without making us aware. He took a risk that could have displeased our family.

10.Bachelor: Really?

10.Bachelor: Really?

11.Georgiy Kain: Even though we were uncertain of when you would arrive, my brother was looking forward to meeting you! The tragedy may have been a consequence of the actions he took in preparation for your arrival. Someone has taken a powerful piece from the chessboard; a piece upon which your position here depended. It is doubly regrettable that Simon was playing on your side...

11.Georgiy Kain: Even though we were uncertain of when you would arrive, my brother was looking forward to meeting you! The tragedy may have been a consequence of the actions he took in preparation for your arrival. Someone has taken a powerful piece from the chessboard; a piece upon which your position here depended. It is doubly regrettable that Simon was playing on your side...

12.Bachelor: So you presume the queen knew of the blow and sacrificed itself for a pawn? But why?

12.Bachelor: So you presume the queen knew of the blow and sacrificed itself for a pawn? But why?

13.Georgiy Kain: To grant you victory over death! Was it not your ultimate aspiration? To help you, Simon seems to have played a very dangerous game with... fate itself. He went out of his way to provide you with a body of evidence.

13.Georgiy Kain: To grant you victory over death! Was it not your ultimate aspiration? To help you, Simon seems to have played a very dangerous game with... fate itself. He went out of his way to provide you with a body of evidence.

14.Bachelor: What did he do?

14.Bachelor: What did he do?

15.Georgiy Kain: It is of no importance to me what exactly he did. He took another leap for the stars and paid a terrible price for it. I repeat: he was murdered. The subject of importance here is the identity of the murderer.

15.Georgiy Kain: It is of no importance to me what exactly he did. He took another leap for the stars and paid a terrible price for it. I repeat: he was murdered. The subject of importance here is the identity of the murderer.

16.Bachelor: Everything has gone to rack and ruin... I wish I could take vengeance upon the person who ripped the life from this man.

16.Bachelor: Everything has gone to rack and ruin... I wish I could take vengeance upon the person who ripped the life from this man.

17.Georgiy Kain: Do you want to help us, doctor? Find the murderer for us. My brother Victor, who is in the wing next door, would share some of his thoughts on the matter. Help us and the reward will not disappoint you.

17.Georgiy Kain: Do you want to help us, doctor? Find the murderer for us. My brother Victor, who is in the wing next door, would share some of his thoughts on the matter. Help us and the reward will not disappoint you.

18.Bachelor: Indeed. It seems there are too many coincidences. Your brother's murder can just as well be called the murder of Bachelor Dankovsky. I will help you in every way I can.

18.Bachelor: Indeed. It seems there are too many coincidences. Your brother's murder can just as well be called the murder of Bachelor Dankovsky. I will help you in every way I can.

19.Georgiy Kain: I am convinced that if there is anyone at all that can help us solve this puzzle, then it is you. This mission calls for someone as astute and inventive as yourself. If Isidor was an instrument of fate, then Simon's murder is a message that fate intended for you personally. Do not think I am inclined to blame you for that, I am not.

19.Georgiy Kain: I am convinced that if there is anyone at all that can help us solve this puzzle, then it is you. This mission calls for someone as astute and inventive as yourself. If Isidor was an instrument of fate, then Simon's murder is a message that fate intended for you personally. Do not think I am inclined to blame you for that, I am not.

20.Bachelor: How do you plan to look for the murderer?

20.Bachelor: How do you plan to look for the murderer?

21.Georgiy Kain: We will take our own measures. The only thing I expect from you is to be yourself. Do only what you think is required. Still, my brother managed to break the seal that locked it away from everyone else.

18.Bachelor: Really?

19.Georgiy Kain: Even though we were uncertain of when you would arrive, my brother was looking forward to meeting you! It is doubly regrettable that Simon was playing on your side...

8.Bachelor: Tell me more.

8.Bachelor: Tell me more.

9.Georgiy Kain: These voices are the ruling families. The co-owners of the Bull Project, who have been ruling the town for almost two centuries. Each one of the truths they represent is screaming at the top of its lungs, and in so doing travesties whatever value it carries.

9.Georgiy Kain: These voices are the ruling families. The co-owners of the Bull Project, who have been ruling the town for almost two centuries. Each one of the truths they represent is screaming at the top of its lungs, and in so doing travesties whatever value it carries.

10.Bachelor: This is too complicated... I don't see what this has to do with your brother's murder.

11.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

11.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

12.Bachelor: You suggest I believe you?

12.Bachelor: You suggest I believe you?

13.Georgiy Kain: I suggest you believe no one. Perhaps I am the only one of the three rulers that would ask you to disregard his very words. If nothing else, I hope it will win me your favour. At least I am offering you honest advice: you should never trust any of us completely-neither the Kains, nor the Olgimskys, nor the Saburovs.

13.Georgiy Kain: I suggest you believe no one. Perhaps I am the only one of the three rulers that would ask you to disregard his very words. If nothing else, I hope it will win me your favour. 14.Bachelor: Such sincerity does indeed inspire trust.

14.Bachelor: Such sincerity does indeed inspire trust.

15.Georgiy Kain: Furthermore, each of us will try to paint a rather ungainly picture of the other two. Most likely we will fill you in on the negative sides of each other faction and withhold anything that is good about them. That is inevitable. None of us will stoop to outright slander, so everything that will be said will most likely be true, but this truth will be one-sided and incomplete. Listen carefully to what we say and take it into account.

10.Bachelor: Who are they?

11.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

15.Georgiy Kain: Furthermore, each of us will try to paint a rather ungainly picture of the other two. Most likely we will fill you in on the negative sides of each other faction and withhold anything that is good about them. That is inevitable. I do not want my brother to have died in vain.

13.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

As you can see, I will stop before nothing to ensure an unbiased investigation; the lack of prejudice I want to instill in you is the one and only reason why I am making a confession like this. I do not want my brother to have died in vain.

22.Bachelor: Here our desires concur, Judge.

14.Bachelor: So I am surrounded by lies? How exciting. Truth is my only idol. It is only for the truth that I fight.

14.Bachelor: So I am surrounded by lies? How exciting. Truth is my only idol. It is only for the truth that I fight.

15.Georgiy Kain: Well, no one will dare lie to your face. I have no doubts everyone will tell you the truth, but they will tell it in such a fashion that this truth will conceal the reality better than any deception would. The only thing I'm asking is that you don't jump to conclusions. Compare different versions. Your extraordinary intelligence will allow you to ascertain the truth.

15.Georgiy Kain: Well, no one will dare lie to your face. The only thing I'm asking is that you don't jump to conclusions. Compare different versions. Your extraordinary intelligence will allow you to ascertain the truth.

16.Bachelor: That inspires hope.

16.Bachelor: That inspires hope.

17.Georgiy Kain: Furthermore, each of us will try to paint a rather ungainly picture of the other two. Most likely we will fill you in on the negative sides of each other faction and withhold anything that is good about them. That is inevitable. None of us will stoop to outright slander, so everything that will be said will most likely be true, but this truth will be one-sided and incomplete. Listen carefully to what we say and take it into account.

12.Bachelor: Who are they?

13.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

I do not want my brother to have died in vain.

17.Georgiy Kain: Furthermore, each of us will try to paint a rather ungainly picture of the other two. 15.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

7.Georgiy Kain: There are three truths that rule this town. Three origins. Three ideas, if you like. For several generations these three powers have been in conflict with each other. I suspect none of them can exist without the other two, yet each of them still strives to dominate. Each of them has its own voice, too.

9.Georgiy Kain: These voices are the ruling families. The co-owners of the Bull Project, who have been ruling the town for almost two centuries. Each one of the truths they represent is screaming at the top of its lungs, and in so doing travesties whatever value it carries.

11.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

None of us will stoop to outright slander, so everything that will be said will most likely be true, but this truth will be one-sided and incomplete. Listen carefully to what we say and take it into account.

16.Bachelor: Thank you.

16.Bachelor: Thank you.

17.Georgiy Kain: The stories of the evil that the Kains have unleashed unto this world are partially true. Do not feel obliged to act in our favour. I do not want my brother to have died in vain.

10.Bachelor: Who are they?

10.Bachelor: Who are they?

11.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

11.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. 12.Bachelor: You suggest I believe you?

13.Georgiy Kain: I suggest you believe no one. Perhaps I am the only one of the three rulers that would ask you to disregard his very words. If nothing else, I hope it will win me your favour. At least I am offering you honest advice: you should never trust any of us completely-neither the Kains, nor the Olgimskys, nor the Saburovs.

I do not want my brother to have died in vain.

11.Georgiy Kain: All I'm saying is that we have all been offered a puzzle. Depending on the solution, heads will roll and backs will get broken. Can you imagine how much blood can be shed over an ideology that has a grain of truth to it?

13.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

17.Georgiy Kain: Furthermore, each of us will try to paint a rather ungainly picture of the other two. 10.Bachelor: Really? I'm all ears then.

11.Georgiy Kain: These voices are the ruling families. The co-owners of the Bull Project, who have been ruling the town for almost two centuries. Each one of the truths they represent is screaming at the top of its lungs, and in so doing travesties whatever value it carries.

11.Georgiy Kain: These voices are the ruling families. The co-owners of the Bull Project, who have been ruling the town for almost two centuries. Each one of the truths they represent is screaming at the top of its lungs, and in so doing travesties whatever value it carries.

12.Bachelor: This is too complicated... I don't see what this has to do with your brother's murder.

12.Bachelor: This is too complicated... I don't see what this has to do with your brother's murder.

13.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

13.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. 14.Bachelor: You suggest I believe you?

15.Georgiy Kain: I suggest you believe no one. Perhaps I am the only one of the three rulers that would ask you to disregard his very words. If nothing else, I hope it will win me your favour. At least I am offering you honest advice: you should never trust any of us completely-neither the Kains, nor the Olgimskys, nor the Saburovs.

16.Bachelor: Such sincerity does indeed inspire trust.

17.Georgiy Kain: Furthermore, each of us will try to paint a rather ungainly picture of the other two. Most likely we will fill you in on the negative sides of each other faction and withhold anything that is good about them. That is inevitable. None of us will stoop to outright slander, so everything that will be said will most likely be true, but this truth will be one-sided and incomplete. Listen carefully to what we say and take it into account.

Can you imagine how much blood can be shed over an ideology that has a grain of truth to it?

15.Georgiy Kain: The first voice is the Saburovs. The second is the Olgimskys. The third one is us, the Kains. We are the three heads of one beast. Each of the clans will offer their own understanding of what is going on. Each of the three will use their own voice and the voices of their followers to lie and distort the truth. We cannot exist otherwise. However, in doing so, we will inadvertently reveal the entirety of the truth to anyone who would listen.

14.Bachelor: I will wait for the required period of time to pass.

14.Bachelor: I will wait for the required period of time to pass.

14.Bachelor: Please take all possible measures to ensure the safety of the body.

14.Bachelor: Please take all possible measures to ensure the safety of the body.

10.Bachelor: I'm afraid I must insist.

10.Bachelor: I'm afraid I must insist.

11.Georgiy Kain: I might have agreed to break the tradition, which is as sacred to us as it is meaningful and reasonable, but I am entirely convinced that there is no valuable information at all for you to derive from the examination of the body. I am sorry, but no exception can be made here; not even for you.

11.Georgiy Kain: I might have agreed to break the tradition, which is as sacred to us as it is meaningful and reasonable, but I am entirely convinced that there is no valuable information at all for you to derive from the examination of the body. I am sorry, but no exception can be made here; not even for you.

12.Bachelor: Reasonable? So it has a practical justification?

12.Bachelor: Reasonable? So it has a practical justification?

13.Georgiy Kain: On several occasions excessive haste has led to undesirable consequences. The phenomenon that Isidor had invited you here to study... it is in our blood. This physiological trait of our family shows itself from time to time.

2.Bachelor: How many doctors are there in your town?

2.Bachelor: How many doctors are there in your town?

3.Georgiy Kain: If we exclude Isidor Burakh, Stanislav Rubin is the only doctor here. He's the most competent of Isidor's apprentices. The rest are good for nothing, as far as I can tell, they're only capable of distorting the knowledge their teacher is trying to pass to them...

3.Georgiy Kain: If we exclude Isidor Burakh, Stanislav Rubin is the only doctor here. He's the most competent of Isidor's apprentices. The rest are good for nothing, as far as I can tell, they're only capable of distorting the knowledge their teacher is trying to pass to them...

4.Bachelor: Do you trust this Rubin?

4.Bachelor: Do you trust this Rubin?

5.Georgiy Kain: I would trust Rubin with my life. A competent medic of remarkable courage and laudable integrity. Everything he does is done with appropriate diligence and care. He doesn't like people that much, but he is eager to serve them. Why do you ask?

5.Georgiy Kain: I would trust Rubin with my life. A competent medic of remarkable courage and laudable integrity. Everything he does is done with appropriate diligence and care. He doesn't like people that much, but he is eager to serve them. Why do you ask?

6.Bachelor: I just wonder what kind of man he is... How do I get to know him?

6.Bachelor: I just wonder what kind of man he is... How do I get to know him?

7.Georgiy Kain: Rubin will come here tonight to get down to... examining my brother. You will get acquainted then.

7.Georgiy Kain: Rubin will come here tonight to get down to... examining my brother. You will get acquainted then.

8.Bachelor: All right.

8.Bachelor: All right.

6.Bachelor: All right.

2.Bachelor: I'd like to speak to Isidor Burakh first and foremost.

2.Bachelor: I'd like to speak to Isidor Burakh first and foremost.

3.Georgiy Kain: Well... that is a reasonable thing to do. Moreover, that is what etiquette demands. After all, it was he that invited you here. However, I don't think he has informed anyone in The Crucible of these plans. I hope you don't get me wrong. You are our guest and we welcome you.

3.Georgiy Kain: Well... that is a reasonable thing to do. Moreover, that is what etiquette demands. After all, it was he that invited you here. However, I don't think he has informed anyone in The Crucible of these plans. I hope you don't get me wrong. You are our guest and we welcome you.

4.Bachelor: Where does Isidor live?

4.Bachelor: Where does Isidor live?

5.Georgiy Kain: Somewhere in Earth... 'Earth' is the name of the lowest part of the town, closest to the Abattoir. I haven't been there for several years... and I don't really know these slums all too well, especially since they were rebuilt after the fire. Victor has visited Isidor from time to time, so speak to him. He is in the wing next door.

5.Georgiy Kain: Somewhere in Earth... 'Earth' is the name of the lowest part of the town, closest to the Abattoir. Victor has visited Isidor from time to time, so speak to him. He is in the wing next door.

6.Bachelor: Fine.

6.Bachelor: Fine.

2.Bachelor: No matter what happens, the truth will be revealed in the end.

2.Bachelor: No matter what happens, the truth will be revealed in the end.

1.Georgiy Kain: I feel guilty for having misled you, dear Bachelor. Forgive this old man... I thought your ignorance of our local affairs would mystically skew the circumstances in your favour. Forgive me if I was wrong. There is no unexpected news to be heard, is there?

1.Georgiy Kain: I feel guilty for having misled you, dear Bachelor. Forgive this old man... I thought your ignorance of our local affairs would mystically skew the circumstances in your favour. Forgive me if I was wrong. There is no unexpected news to be heard, is there?

2.Bachelor: No. The disease is spreading around the town already. It is necessary that we urgently appoint mid-level executives. Get all the doctors and hospital attendants.

2.Bachelor: No. The disease is spreading around the town already. It is necessary that we urgently appoint mid-level executives. Get all the doctors and hospital attendants.

3.Georgiy Kain: Let Saburov take care of that. After all, he was the one to demand emergency powers from us, which were granted. I've already sent all of my men to assist him, as well as an appreciable amount of money to further his administrative activities. We don't have any doctors or hospital attendants. The only man that knows something about medicine is currently examining my brother's body. It is strange there's been no news from him so far... We need to send someone after him.

3.Georgiy Kain: Let Saburov take care of that. After all, he was the one to demand emergency powers from us, which were granted. 4.Bachelor: And what about you? What are you going to do?

4.Bachelor: And what about you? What are you going to do?

5.Georgiy Kain: We will fight... until the very end. I will personally persecute those who would dare describe this disease as some kind of preordained divine retribution! I will attack anyone who would say Simon got what he deserved! Finally, I will not allow anyone to say that what Simon has built by ceaseless labour is subject to inevitable destruction.

5.Georgiy Kain: We will fight... until the very end. I will personally persecute those who would dare describe this disease as some kind of preordained divine retribution! 6.Bachelor: Retribution for what?

6.Bachelor: Retribution for what?

7.Georgiy Kain: Sooner or later the one who dares challenge the mechanics of nature will pay the price. But this is not something we'd want to believe, is it? This is a conclusion drawn by people who tend to mistake their exhaustion for wisdom. However, even an echo would sometimes grow to become deafening noise. If people keep saying we're doomed, they might well bring about our extinction.

8.Bachelor: What now, Judge?

9.Georgiy Kain: We're not that different from each other, dear Bachelor. I am grateful for everything you've done for us, I appreciate the risk you took to help us, and I am much obliged for the disheartening conclusion you have reached. No matter what you are going to do, you can count on our full support. The reward we have promised you will be duly delivered. Victor will make all the necessary arrangements.

5.Georgiy Kain: That's the easiest way. All the time we tend to be governed by either of the two extremities. We follow our heart and refuse to weigh the consequences of our actions, or we keep on reasoning, becoming flaccid with well-calculated inaction... Where is that spot that marks the perfect balance of the two? Only the chosen ones, like my brother, could aim for it with steadfast precision.

1.Georgiy Kain: You saved my life, dear doctor. Thank you. My life is crucial to feeding another one; do not rebuke me for my untimely selfishness. I'll have a chance to put it to good use in the near future.

2.Bachelor: What are you going to do with your life, Judge? Tell me.

3.Georgiy Kain: I've already done what I wanted. My life expectancy was low anyway. Why should I stretch my last days, accumulate diseases and grow to become a burden for my relatives? No... the best thing I can do now is to give way to my niece.

3.Georgiy Kain: I've already done what I wanted. My life expectancy was low anyway. Why should I stretch my last days, accumulate diseases and grow to become a burden for my relatives? No... the best thing I can do now is to give way to my niece.

4.Bachelor: You are fading away quickly, Judge. Life is leaving you. How much do you have left?

5.Georgiy Kain: Not much. But I do not need much. Pretty soon the spirit will find a more worthy vessel than this old body.
